definitions.text: (usually followed by `of') having capacity or ability
examples: capable of walking on two feet
the time is fixed by the director and players and therefore subject to much variation

definitions.text: (followed by `of') having the temperament or inclination for
examples: no one believed her capable of murder
the work isn't up to the standard I require

definitions.text: have the skills and qualifications to do things well
examples: children as young as 14 can be extremely capable and dependable
